It looks like you have Mylar for Eclipse 3.1 loaded into 3.2RC1, because the code in the stack is 3.1 only.  Could you have installed from the e3.1 update site instead of e3.2?  Or perhaps have an old version in plug-in extension directory?  Uninstalling this version and reinstalling should address this.  

It would be helpful if you could mention how you got into this state--Mylar for 3.1 is supposed to fail to install into Eclipse 3.2 (and vice-versa) when using the update manager.

You are right, the plugin is loaded from an extension location, which contains my 3.1 plugins, so this bug itself might probably be closed as invalid.

But why does Eclipse 3.2 load that plugin at all then? Shouldn't the dependencies from Mylar to the base Eclipse plugins prevent that (as those are not available as 3.1 versions in that installation)? I thought that sharing extension locations between different Eclipse versions would work out of the box, but it seems to be a bit more complicated.
We may be able to prevent this by specifying the precise dependencies for plug-ins in addition to the features, which seem to only get detected by the update manager based on your report.

It sounds like this has been solved nicely in 0.9.2
And should no longer be an issue. Afaik the feature layout is now aligned with Europa recommendations.

Actually, I was wrong. The problem still exists in version 0.9.2 and 1.0.0.
The feature org.eclipse.mylar_feature still imports  the feature org.eclipse.platform.

(In reply to comment #5)
> Actually, I was wrong. The problem still exists in version 0.9.2 and 1.0.0.
> The feature org.eclipse.mylar_feature still imports  the feature
> org.eclipse.platform.

This is no longer the case, and hasn't been so since 1.0.1 or thereabouts.  If you have additional feature/dependency change requests please reopen.
